name: Cotton
description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll, or protective case, around the seeds of the cotton plants of the genus Gossypium in the mallow family Malvaceae.
why_its_bad: Cotton is a water-intensive crop. It takes about 2,700 liters of water to produce enough cotton for a single t-shirt. Cotton is also a pesticide-intensive crop. It uses about 16% of the world's insecticides and 7% of pesticides. Cotton is also a very labor-intensive crop. It is often grown in developing countries where labor laws are not enforced.
why_its_good: Cotton is a natural fiber that is biodegradable. It is also a renewable resource. Cotton is also a very versatile fabric that can be used for a variety of products.

name: Polyester
